name: colemanite mine operation and beneficiation | calcium borates | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/26013/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of calcium borate from colemanite, a naturally occurring mineral containing boron in form of B2O3, which is extracted from open pit sites. The beneficiation process is carried out by disintegration, washing and classification in the size fractions in large sizes. Calcium borate is used in many sectors, for example as flame retardant in resin-based compounds, as a ceramic flux in ceramic glazes, and as additive in fertilizers. This dataset considers the production of calcium borate occurring in open pit sites in Turkey, which owns approximately 73% of the world’s boron reserves and 35% in the production and trade of borates. ;References:;Önal, G., & Burat, F. (2008). Boron mining and processing in Turkey. Gospodarka Surowcami Mineralnymi, 24(3), 49-60.;USGS, 2017. Minerals Yearbook - Boron. ;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - calcium borates production, TR, 2000 - 2000 (a2da0661-05d6-4ad8-8435-6121aec181d3)]

The activity starts with the mining of colemanite (Ca2B6O11 * 5H2O) from the ground. 

The activity ends with the production of colemanite concentrate.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/089:Mining and quarrying n.e.c./0891:Mining of chemical and fertilizer minerals
tags: Sector: Resource Extraction; Minerals; Agriculture & Animal Husbandry

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data used represent conditions in Turkey. Proxy data from a study in Mexico were used for some flows. See specific comments to exchanges.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Calcium borates are obtained from surface mining of colemanite (Ca2B6O11 * 5H2O) deposits. Open pit mining requires extensive drilling and blasting to reach load deposits. Ores are removed from the mine and transported to milling and beneficiating plants for concentrating the ore. Concentration, or beneficiation, is carried out by disintegration, washing and classification in the size fractions in large sizes, At Emet Colemanite Concentration plant (Turkey), a colemanite ore of 27% B2O3 content is treated to produce a concentrate having 43% B2O3. ;Reference:;Önal, G., & Burat, F. (2008). Boron mining and processing in Turkey. Gospodarka Surowcami Mineralnymi, 24(3), 49-60.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
The inputs of energy, diesel and process water were approximated from the pre-feasibility study in Mexican colemanite deposits (Allard et al., 2013). The amount of airborne emissions was retrieved from the Energy and Environmental Profile of the U.S. Mining Industry (2013). The amount of gangue in ground, the tailings and wastewater were calculated to obtain mass balance, For further details, see comments to the related exchanges. 

References:

Allard, G., Salazar Velazquez, R., Verley, C.G., Vidal, M.F., 2013. Preliminary Economic Assessment for the El Cajon Borate Deposit, Magdalena Basin Project, Sonora, Mexico (Pursuant to National Instrument 43-101 of the Canadian Securities Administrators)
Energy and Environmental Profile of the U.S. Mining Industry, 2013. Chapter 3: Potash, Soda Ash, and Borates. Table 3-6, Available at:  https://www.energy.gov/sites/prod/files/2013/11/f4/potash_soda_borate.pdf
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Due to lack of specific information on the extraction of boron from colemanite in Turkey, some values were approximated and others copied from the previous dataset "calcium borates production" (GLO)  as published in ecoinvent v.3.8, based on Althaus et al. (2007). See Extrapolations and exchange comments for more details.

Reference:
Althaus H.-J., Chudacoff M., Hischier R., Jungbluth N., Osses M. and Primas A. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Chemicals. ecoinvent report No. 8, v2.0. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH, from www.ecoinvent.org <http://www.ecoinvent.org>.

exchanges.description:
Approximation from the pre-feasibility study in Mexico colemanite deposits (Chapter  21.0 Capital and operating coast, Table 22): 50m3 natural gas are required for 1 metric ton colemanite. 36.3 MJ/m3 --> Conversion in MJ in data quality guidelines.

Reference:
Allard, G., Salazar Velazquez, R., Verley, C.G., Vidal, M.F., 2013. Preliminary Economic Assessment for the El Cajon Borate Deposit, Magdalena Basin Project, Sonora, Mexico (Pursuant to National Instrument 43-101 of the Canadian Securities Administrators).

exchanges.description:
Calculated value, based on the B2O3 content in both colemanite ores (27%) and in calcium borate (43%). Recovery rate of B2O3 (78.7%) is assumed as for sodium borate.

Reference: Önal, G., & Burat, F. (2008). Boron mining and processing in Turkey. Gospodarka Surowcami Mineralnymi, 24(3), 49-60.

Approximation from the pre-feasibility study in Mexico colemanite deposits deposits (Chapter  21.0 Capital and operating coast, Table 22): 143 tonnes of fuel are required for 50K tonnes of colemanite.  Conversion in MJ: 42.8 MJ/kg according to Ecoinvent data quality guidelines. 

Reference:

exchanges.description:
Amount taken from the dataset "calcium borates production" (GLO) as published in ecoinvent v3.8, based on Althaus et al. (2007). 

Reference:
Althaus H.-J., Chudacoff M., Hischier R., Jungbluth N., Osses M. and Primas A. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Chemicals. ecoinvent report No. 8, v2.0. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH, from www.ecoinvent.org <http://www.ecoinvent.org>.

Calculated value based on boron content in colemanite in ground. At Emet Colemanite Concentration plant (Turkey) a colemanite ore of 27% B2O3 content is treated to produce a concentrate having 43% B2O3. Recovery rate of 78.7% as assumed for sodium borates. B MW = 10.81 g/mol; O MW = 16 g/mol

Reference: Önal, G., & Burat, F. (2008). Boron mining and processing in Turkey. Gospodarka Surowcami Mineralnymi, 24(3), 49-60.
Calculated value based "mine construction, open cast, non-ferrous metal" (GLO) dataset and the amount of mined ores.

Literature. Particulates are generated from the dryers, and have an average diameter of 44um. This value is approximated with the emissions of particulate from the mining of sodium borates.
